definition: silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: Loofah body is uneven, the head also wore a yellow color of the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 丝瓜身上是凹凸不平的，头上还顶着个黄颜色的小花。

sentences.english: How do you prevent loofah from turning black?
sentences.chinese: 丝瓜要如何烹调较不易变黑？

sentences.english: Oh, by the way, where did you get that loofah mitt?
sentences.chinese: 对了，你的丝瓜沐浴手套是在哪儿买的？

sentences.english: Luffa showed a good foreground for improving skin look.
sentences.chinese: 丝瓜水在美容护肤方面表现出良好的应用前景。

sentences.english: But this year, before they turned ripe, they were all picked by his neighbors for food.
sentences.chinese: 可今年，还没等丝瓜成熟，就被邻居们摘去炒菜了。

sentences.english: Luffa strong vitality is one of the characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 生命力强是丝瓜的其中一个特点。

sentences.english: Every year Du plants towel gourds in the community yard for discount p90x dvd.
sentences.chinese: 杜大爷每年都会在社区院子里种些丝瓜，美化社区。

sentences.english: Luffa is not just people as well.
sentences.chinese: 不只是丝瓜，人也是一样。

sentences.english: Howard:More precisely, we used your loofah.
sentences.chinese: 准确的说，我们用了你的丝瓜手套。

sentences.english: Luffa cylindrica (L. ) Roem. is unisexual flower and monoecism plant.
sentences.chinese: 丝瓜为单性花，雌雄同株植物。

sentences.english: A kind of gourd called the luffa is used to make sponges.
sentences.chinese: 一种叫做丝瓜的葫芦科作物被用来制造海绵。

sentences.english: Allow me to tell you something about the loofah .
sentences.chinese: 请允许我告诉你们一些关于丝瓜的事情。

sentences.english: Why do you suppose a man would be ashamed of having a loofah?
sentences.chinese: 你说为什么一个男人会为使用丝瓜络而感到羞耻？

sentences.english: Natural greenness loofah gloves use for body scrub in bath.
sentences.chinese: 绿色天然丝瓜手套用于擦洗身体，在洗澡。

sentences.english: They were covered with the vines of towel gourd .
sentences.chinese: 丝瓜那绿油油的蔓条攀满了瓜架。

sentences.english: Mom and I took off the towel gourd harvest of joy.
sentences.chinese: 我和妈妈带着丰收的喜悦摘下了丝瓜。

definition: eggplant (Solanum melongena L.)/aubergine/brinjal/Guinea squash/phonetic "cheese" (when being photographed)/equivalent of "say cheese"
wax gourd (Cucurbitaceae, Benincasa hispida)/white gourd/white hairy melon/Chinese squash
Manchurian wild rice 菰[gu1], aka water bamboo, or its edible stem, which resembles a bamboo shoot
radish (Raphanus sativus), esp. white radish 白蘿蔔|白萝卜[bai2 luo2 bo5]/CL:條|条[tiao2]
